publications.title: Generation and heterozygous repair of human iPSC lines from three individuals with cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy and vestibular areflexia syndrome (CANVAS) carrying biallelic AAGGG expansions in RFC1

donor.disease_description: Progressive neurodegenerative disorder characterized by cerebellar impairment, bilateral vestibular hypofunction, and sensory neuropathy
donor.disease_name: Cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy, and vestibular areflexia syndrome (CANVAS)

genomic_modifications.description: Heterozygous gene correction of biallelic AAGGG expansion in RFC1
genomic_modifications.genotype: Heterozygous deletion of AAGGG expansion in RFC1 intron 2

genomic_characterisation.summary: No aneuploidies were detected. SNP array analysis confirmed 46,XX karyotype.

induced_derivation.non_int_vector_name: pEP4 E02S ET2K, pEP4 E02S EN2L, pEP4 E02S EM2K, pSimple-miR302/367

ethics.institutional_HREC: Human Research Ethics Committee of the Royal Children's Hospital
